list_definition.definition: a fastening for a strap or band

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a belt with a silver buckle.

list_definition.definition: (usually of something metal) to make or become bent or crushed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The metal buckled in the fierce heat of the fire.

list_ex_of_english: There have been other cases of buckling in hot weather.
The operation was difficult, as the bulkhead had buckled, but by their united efforts the door was eventually closed, leaving only a slight leak.
The men are buckling to, pulling their weight and showing that they have confidence in the future.
I also recognise that some devices can be defeated by buckling the belt behind the seat.
I was appalled to find that the impact buckled the chassis of my car.
Since the microneedles which were tested had a much greater wall thickness, it is safe to assume that buckling would not occur.
They can fail either by "buckling" or be being "crushed" due to the pressure exerted.
A pipe-maker was robbed of his muslin cravat, striped handkerchief, leather shoes and iron buckles.
